title: Part A (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the hydrophobic tails of the phospholipid fatty acids block the movement of large and polar molecules, which require protein channels to cross the membrane.
The response indicates that the hydrophobic tails of the phospholipid fatty acids block the movement of large and polar molecules, which require protein channels to cross the membrane.

title: Part A (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that osmosis will cause an overall movement of water out of the cells and that the cells will shrink.
The response indicates that osmosis will cause an overall movement of water out of the cells and that the cells will shrink.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The sketched bars/curve meet(s) none of the following criteria.
The sketched bars/curve meet(s) one of the following criteria.
The sketched bars/curve meet(s) two of the following criteria.
The sketched bars/curve meet(s) all of the following criteria.

title: Part C (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the amount of fluid ejected decreases with increasing solute concentration. The response does not elaborate that there is a large change in ejection volume when comparing paramecia in freshwater to paramecia in 250 milliosmoles of solute/kg MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGZbGaae4Bai aabYgacaqG1bGaaeiDaiaabwgacaqGVaGaae4AaiaabEgaaaa@4136@ or that, with paramecia in higher salinities, the amount of fluid ejected continues to decrease as salinity increases.

The response indicates that the amount of fluid ejected decreases with increasing solute concentration. There is a large change in ejection volume when comparing paramecia in freshwater to paramecia in 250 milliosmoles of solute/kg MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGZbGaae4Bai aabYgacaqG1bGaaeiDaiaabwgacaqGVaGaae4AaiaabEgaaaa@4136@ . With paramecia in higher salinities, the amount of fluid ejected continues to decrease as salinity increases.
